Description: Glazed composition amuletic figure, rather crudely executed, in the form of a seated cat (?), transversely pierced for suspension. The glaze is brown with reddish patches.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, North-west Ptolemaic mound ?
Curator's comments: Probably one of the 6 "cats" among the "much smaller and ruder" "glazed pottery amulets of late work, probably late Ptolemaic", from the North-west mound, mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 79 § 79. See the similar London, BM, EA 20676, 20677, 20679, 20680 and possibly 20685 or 20694.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 79 § 79) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.40, p.45, p.62, p.63, p.64, p.181, pl.23)
